intro: Adnaria adenochaeta, commonly known as the hairy sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its blue or violet flowers and hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal dunes and cliffs. Adnaria adenochaeta is well adapted to salt spray and is an important component of coastal vegetation.
